Row.Text: Your religion starts with a pantheon Belief. Add one more Belief to your religion when completing each of these Civics: Mummification, Book of the Dead, and Amun: Lord of All Gods.
A [COLOR:NeutralCS]SCORE[ENDCOLOR] victory cannot occur in this scenario. Scores are only tracked to determine the level of victory at the moment that you complete 7 Temples to Amun.
+2 [ICON_Culture] Culture in every Holy Site district.
Additional +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture in every Holy Site district.
+2 [ICON_Science] Science in every Holy Site district.
Additional +2 [ICON_Science] Science in every Holy Site district.
All Builders can build 1 extra improvement.
+30% [ICON_Production] Production toward wonders. [ICON_Faith] Faith purchase costs reduced by 30%.
Combat victories provide [ICON_Science] Science equal to 50% of the [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength of the defeated unit.
All Holy Site buildings provide +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith.
One extra Wildcard policy slot in any government.
Combat units gain +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when within the borders of friendly cities.
+3 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +3 [ICON_Faith] Faith, and +2 [ICON_Production] Production on Oasis tiles.
+1 [ICON_Food] Food and +1 [ICON_Production] Production on all Floodplain tiles. May only be built in a city adjacent to a Nile River tile.

Provides Walls around the City Center and Encampment district. Walls allow [ICON_Ranged] Ranged Strikes from the City Center and Encampment district, and must be defeated before a city can be assaulted.
Receive boosts to all Ancient and Classical era technologies. Must be built on flat land.
+2 [ICON_Movement] Movement for all naval units[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built on the Coast, and adjacent to land and a Harbor district with a Lighthouse.
Prebuilt before the scenario begins at Giza, a site near the city-state of On. Can be captured to gain a major source of Faith and to award all new Builders the ability to build 1 extra improvement.
There is no unique bonus for becoming Suzerain of this city-state.
Receive a free Settler in your [ICON_Capital] Capital upon completion.
Allows you to add a Belief to your religion.
Receive a free Settler in your [ICON_Capital] Capital upon completion.
Allows creation of one more [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route. Awards 1 [ICON_Envoy] Envoy.
Allows you to add a Belief to your religion.
Receive a free Settler in your [ICON_Capital] Capital upon completion.
Receive a free [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General in your [ICON_Capital] Capital upon completion. Grants flanking and support combat bonuses to all combat units.
Allows you to add a Belief to your religion.

A district for naval activity in your city. Also removes the [ICON_Movement] Movement penalty for embarking and disembarking to and from this tile. Must be built on Coast, Nile River, or Lake Terrain adjacent to land.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity, if this city does not yet have a Commercial Hub district.
+{1_num} [ICON_Faith] Faith from the adjacent Nile River {1_Num : plural 1?tile; other?tiles;}.
+{1_num} [ICON_Gold] Gold from the adjacent Nile River {1_Num : plural 1?tile; other?tiles;}.
[ICON_Capital] Capital receives +2 boost to all yields.
+2 [ICON_Housing] Housing in any city with a Holy Site.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Bonus to all units within 2 tiles.

Unlocks the High Priestess ability to construct a Sphinx, unique to Egypt.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture. +1 Appeal. +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith if next to a wonder or Holy Site. Cannot be built next to another Sphinx. Can be built on Floodplains.
+50% [ICON_Production] Production toward Ancient and Classical era melee and ranged units.
+100% [ICON_Production] Production toward Ancient and Classical era heavy and light cavalry units.
+1 [ICON_Science] Science for each city adjacent to a water tile.
Pay half the usual cost to levy city-state units.
Doubles [ICON_Science] Science output of all of your cities.
Unit maintenance reduced by 1 [ICON_Gold] Gold per turn, per unit.
Can be constructed through [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes. Improves [ICON_Movement] Movement speed of any unit moving from one road tile to another.
Allows all land units to embark.
Receive 2 free Settlers in your [ICON_Capital] Capital upon completion.
Each [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General has a passive combat effect on nearby units in this scenario.
Great [ICON_GreatProphet] Prophets are not found in this scenario. Both Egypt and Nubia gain a religion automatically as soon as their capital city is founded.
Egyptian unique Ancient era ranged unit that replaces the Heavy Chariot. 6 [ICON_Movement] Movement when starting in open terrain.
May create new cities. Settlers are only received in this scenario by completing Civics and the Technology Medicine. They can never be built.
A unique Builder whose only function is to create a single Sphinx or Nubian Pyramid.
Strong melee unit with a large combat bonus if in friendly territory and within 1 tile of a Holy Site. May only build Medjay in a city with a Holy Site that contains a Shrine building.
+{1_Value} Combat Strength in friendly territory near Holy Site.
+20 [ICON_Strength] Combat Bonus when adjacent to a Holy Site Shrine.
Grow your civilization to at least 24 population.
With the land around our early cities developing nicely, we can fine tune our production techniques.
Your contact with other states has opened up opportunities for lucrative trade.
Our city is growing so quickly we need a new class of workers to help us track everything.
We have some fallen heroes from our city conquest. Let us ease their passage through the underworld.
Our learned mathematicians are a model for scholarship. Let us aid them by collecting the knowledge of the world under one roof.
With Encampment is place to defend our lands and survey our borders, we can now assert our regional authority.
The growing number of citizens in your lands need more entertainment. Shall we play senet or try our hand at archery?
Our people now recognize the one supreme god, Amun. Let us build great temples to celebate this creator of the staff of life.
Be the target of a Declaration of War.
Have the Book of the Dead civic.
Your fishermen are helping us learn how to build boats for military purposes.
Your numerous farms give you an appreciation of the importance of irrigating your crops.
Domesticating animals should prove useful. Can we get them to carry troops to battle?
You are mixing in herbs with the crops at your plantations. Do some have medicinal uses?
Faced with the threat of invasion, your people are ready to come up with innovative defenses.
With all the proper prayers recorded, we can now build tombs to honor our greatest people.
Your galley crews are learning how to guide their travels based on studying the night sky.
Your best scientific minds are getting quite accurate with their predictions of the Nile floods.
We have defeated enough Swordsmen that we soon should be able to field similar units.
We have defeated enough Horsemen that we soon should be able to field similar units.
You have become the first player to build 7 Temples to the glory of the great god Amun. Surely a great pyramid should be constructed to celebrate your accomplishments!
The lord of all gods honors you. (Don’t let it go to your head.)
She weeps tears of joy for your accomplishment.
He prepares special canopic jars for your entrails.
For honoring his works, you shall never encounter a sandstorm.
Maybe next time he’ll remember to warn you about the snakes.
You’ll find no oasis in any desert—just sand upon sand upon sand.
Pharaoh Mentuhotep II Ascends the Throne

The Old Kingdom is no more. Though civil war shakes the land, your family's destiny is an Egypt reunited. Perhaps the short-term aid of Nubian mercenaries can help you reclaim the cities along the Nile river.
Your family commands a vital section of the Nile river. With your Egyptian neighbors to the north beset by internal strife, the Land of the Bow finds itself on the verge of empire.
The Nubian mercenaries completed their contract. They return to the Land of the Bow.
Our mercenary archers completed their contract with Egypt. They return home seasoned and well-paid.
The great Mentuhotep II seeks nothing less than the reunification of Upper and Lower Egypt. Should he succeed, we will honor him with the title "Horus Who Unites the Two Lands."
With Mentuhotep II's death, his life-force departs his body and begins a new journey into the afterlife. There he will meet the judgment of Osiris. May his deeds earn him eternal life.
A religious leader arises to complete your new place of worship. With her aid we can forge new symbols of the divine powers possessed by our gods.
The righteous King Piye seeks to free the Egyptian people from the rot at the heart of their masters. He must do so even if this extends Nubian rule deep into Egyptian territory.
With Piye's death, his life-force departs his body and begins a new journey into the afterlife. There he will meet the judgment of Osiris. May his deeds earn him eternal life.
The fierce Queen Amanirenas does not fear the foreign invaders. Should any threaten Nubia, she will personally lead the attack—even if they are the world's most powerful armies.
With Amanirenas' death, her life-force departs her body and begins a new journey into the afterlife. There she will meet the judgment of Osiris. May her deeds earn her eternal life.
Foreign invaders arrive from the northeast! The Hyksos command a fierce chariot-born army from the Levant. They arrive bearing a tool of war never before experienced along the Nile—the horse.
Foreign invaders arrive from Mediterranean! The Libyans come from the west, marching toward the Nile along the coast. From the east come their mysterious allies—the Sea People.
Foreign invaders arrive from the northeast! Assyrians led by Sha-Nabu-shu have already conquered Mesopotamian lands. Beware this fearsome foe!
Foreign invaders arrive from the north! The Persians are hot on the heels of the Assyrians. Will either kingdom from the east gain a foothold along the Nile?
Foreign invaders arrive from the northeast! The conquests of Alexander III of Macedon are said to stretch to the ends of the earth. Now he seeks to add the Nile people to his empire.
Foreign invaders arrive from the north! The mighty legions of the Roman army came from the west to claim the Nile for themselves. Can anyone halt the mightiest army of the era?
At great expense, we trained war elephants at a secret training grounds. Guard them closely—we can maintain their numbers, despite their slow breeding, but do not expect to train more.
These Nubian Pítati Archers will serve in your army for the next 6 turns.
Found a city and explore the rich mineral deposits nearby.
Your Pítati Archer units have been removed.
These experienced Pítati Archers are now available near our [ICON_Capital] Capital. We have also gained 100 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
This [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General will lead our troops for the next 15 turns.
The [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General Mentuhotep II has been removed.
This High Priestess can be used to build your unique improvement (Sphinx or Nubian Pyramid) once you have researched the Masonry technology.
This [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General will lead our troops for the next 15 turns.
The [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General Piye has been removed.
This [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General will lead our troops for the next 15 turns.
The [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General Amanirenas has been removed.
These Hyksos invaders will try to conquer cities and establish a kingdom along the Mediterranean coast.
These Libyan invaders will try to conquer cities and establish a kingdom along the Mediterranean coast.
These Assyrian invaders will try to conquer cities and establish a kingdom along the Mediterranean coast.
These Persian invaders will try to conquer cities and establish a kingdom along the Mediterranean coast.
These Macedonian invaders will try to conquer cities and establish a kingdom along the Mediterranean coast.
These Roman invaders will try to conquer cities and establish a kingdom along the Mediterranean coast.
New War Elephant units are now available. They are not buildable in a city and can only be received by this event.
